rules.text: Any kind of adult content that includes underage persons is not allowed
Keep local timeline safe for work
Be careful with people that don't understand jokes, they can be offended
Try to keep civil discourse even if the other side is not. Some people don't really know when their behavior is toxic. That does not make them bad
Respect free speech, but do not abuse it
Keep public content in English, French, or Russian. Don't forget to set the correct one in the post's settings
Mention that you read the rules in the registration message. Otherwise, your account will not be approved
Remember, each ActivityPub instance has its own set of rules. Other servers have no obligation to follow our rule set, but you can always block accounts/servers on your side

records.text: Started #reading _The Portal in the Picture_. It's by Lewis Padgett and CL Moore, according to the cover. But there's a problem there.Henry Kuttner was a #ScienceFiction and #Fantasy author, as was his wife Catherine Lucille Moore, who used her initials as her #SFF name. Fine. The pair also wrote together under the #PenName Lewis Padgett (their mothers' maiden names).So this particular #novel claims to be #written by CL Moore and Henry Kuttner and CL Moore. Did Moore do twice the work? The ISFDb page is also odd. 1949 serialization by Henry Kuttner alone, under the Portal name. 1954 novel printing, same name, Kuttner. But also a 1954 printing as _Beyond Earth's Gates_ by Moore and Padgett. And a 2012 reprint by Moore alone, under the Beyond title. None of the cover pictures on ISFDb match the one on my copy, with the Portal name and both LP and CLM as authors.

records.text: Started #reading _The Portal in the Picture_. It's by Lewis Padgett and CL Moore, according to the cover. But there's a problem there.Henry Kuttner was a #ScienceFiction and #Fantasy author, as was his wife Catherine Lucille Moore, who used her initials as her #SFF name. Fine. The pair also wrote together under the #PenName Lewis Padgett (their mothers' maiden names).So this particular #novel claims to be #written by CL Moore and Henry Kuttner and CL Moore. Did Moore do twice the work? The ISFDb page is also odd. 1949 serialization by Henry Kuttner alone, under the Portal name. 1954 novel printing, same name, Kuttner. But also a 1954 printing as _Beyond Earth's Gates_ by Moore and Padgett. And a 2012 reprint by Moore alone, under the Beyond title. None of the cover pictures on ISFDb match the one on my copy, with the Portal name and both LP and CLM as authors.

records.text: Started #reading _The Portal in the Picture_. It's by Lewis Padgett and CL Moore, according to the cover. But there's a problem there.Henry Kuttner was a #ScienceFiction and #Fantasy author, as was his wife Catherine Lucille Moore, who used her initials as her #SFF name. Fine. The pair also wrote together under the #PenName Lewis Padgett (their mothers' maiden names).So this particular #novel claims to be #written by CL Moore and Henry Kuttner and CL Moore. Did Moore do twice the work? The ISFDb page is also odd. 1949 serialization by Henry Kuttner alone, under the Portal name. 1954 novel printing, same name, Kuttner. But also a 1954 printing as _Beyond Earth's Gates_ by Moore and Padgett. And a 2012 reprint by Moore alone, under the Beyond title. None of the cover pictures on ISFDb match the one on my copy, with the Portal name and both LP and CLM as authors.

records.text: Started #reading _The Portal in the Picture_. It's by Lewis Padgett and CL Moore, according to the cover. But there's a problem there.Henry Kuttner was a #ScienceFiction and #Fantasy author, as was his wife Catherine Lucille Moore, who used her initials as her #SFF name. Fine. The pair also wrote together under the #PenName Lewis Padgett (their mothers' maiden names).So this particular #novel claims to be #written by CL Moore and Henry Kuttner and CL Moore. Did Moore do twice the work? The ISFDb page is also odd. 1949 serialization by Henry Kuttner alone, under the Portal name. 1954 novel printing, same name, Kuttner. But also a 1954 printing as _Beyond Earth's Gates_ by Moore and Padgett. And a 2012 reprint by Moore alone, under the Beyond title. None of the cover pictures on ISFDb match the one on my copy, with the Portal name and both LP and CLM as authors.

records.text: Actor Bill Cobbs died today. He was a terrific actor and a lovely human being.I had the absolute pleasure of working with Bill on an episode of The Outer Limits that I wrote and produced. But, before that, I'd seen Bill once on stage in a production of James Baldwin's "The Amen Corner" at Baltimore's Center Stage. It's about a woman who runs a storefront church in Harlem and what happens when her ex husband - a jazz musician played by Bill - comes home more or less to die.It was the first time a play blew me away so intensely that I couldn't get out of my seat after the show. I think the ushers had to pull me out of the theater. That I got to work with an actor who did that to me in the theater? Sublime!Here's to you, Mr. Cobbs, sir! You were a remarkable artist, a consummate professional and a delightful human being! https://variety.com/2024/film/people-news/bill-cobbs-dead-west-wing-bodyguard-1236049909/?

records.text: Actor Bill Cobbs died today. But, before that, I'd seen Bill once on stage in a production of James Baldwin's "The Amen Corner" at Baltimore's Center Stage. It's about a woman who runs a storefront church in Harlem and what happens when her ex husband - a jazz musician played by Bill - comes home more or less to die.It was the first time a play blew me away so intensely that I couldn't get out of my seat after the show. I think the ushers had to pull me out of the theater. That I got to work with an actor who did that to me in the theater? Sublime!Here's to you, Mr. Cobbs, sir! records.text: Actor Bill Cobbs died today. He was a terrific actor and a lovely human being.I had the absolute pleasure of working with Bill on an episode of The Outer Limits that I wrote and produced. But, before that, I'd seen Bill once on stage in a production of James Baldwin's "The Amen Corner" at Baltimore's Center Stage. It's about a woman who runs a storefront church in Harlem and what happens when her ex husband - a jazz musician played by Bill - comes home more or less to die.It was the first time a play blew me away so intensely that I couldn't get out of my seat after the show. I think the ushers had to pull me out of the theater. That I got to work with an actor who did that to me in the theater? Sublime!Here's to you, Mr. Cobbs, sir! You were a remarkable artist, a consummate professional and a delightful human being! https://variety.com/2024/film/people-news/bill-cobbs-dead-west-wing-bodyguard-1236049909/?
